{"step_by_step_thinking": "Crouzon syndrome is a genetic disorder characterized by the premature fusion of certain skull bones. This early fusion prevents the skull from growing normally and affects the shape of the head and face. Features of Crouzon syndrome include midface hypoplasia (A), a beak-shaped nose (C), and ocular hypertelorism (D). Syndactyly (B), which is the fusion of two or more digits, is not typically a feature of Crouzon syndrome.", "answer_choice": "B"}
